reviews.title: Beautiful Nature Walk!
reviews.text: I went about 9 to 10am on a Tuesday in early April, it was still like winter but oh! How wonderful to walk in the lovely quiet in nature, hearing the birds sing! What a joy!

reviews.title: A MUST
reviews.text: For anyone exploring the city must visit the Central Park.itâ€™s very huge you canâ€™t explore it in one day.our guide was very informative and he took us to all the beatiful and the best locations.

reviews.title: Favorite place
reviews.text: In new York City it's my favorite place My Place My Home. Feels like a resort here Greenery everywhere. Friendly people. Nice place for a walk and sports. Simply Love it

reviews.title: The Best Way to Experience Central Park
reviews.text: I've done several Central Park Conservancy tours - different tours at at different times of year. I always come back for more! The guides are well/informed and incredibly personable. It is my favorite way to experience the park.

reviews.title: test
reviews.text: Central Park in New York City is truly a gem and a must-visit for anyone exploring the city. Spanning 843 acres, it offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. The park is perfect for leisurely strolls, with its winding paths, expansive lawns, and beautifully landscaped gardens. There are countless picturesque spots, from the iconic Bow Bridge to the tranquil Bethesda Terrace. One of the parkâ€™s highlights is the variety of activities available. You can rent a bike, paddle a boat on the lake, or simply relax with a picnic on the Great Lawn. The Central Park Zoo is a fun stop, especially for families, and there are several playgrounds scattered throughout. The park is also home to some lovely fountains, statues, and art installations that make each visit unique. During my visit, I enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere, even though it was a busy weekend. The contrast between the city's skyscrapers and the park's natural beauty is something you canâ€™t experience anywhere else. Whether you're visiting for a quick escape or spending a whole day, Central Park offers something for everyone. Itâ€™s a perfect blend of nature and city life. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Enjoyable place in chaotic NYC.
reviews.text: We took a carriage ride and thoroughly enjoyed it. There were some homeless drunk people but they didnâ€™t cause us trouble. Just sad to see. Itâ€™s a huge park.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: While I was back here for a morning walk after just over a year, Central Park never ceases to amaze me, with its quietude and beauty! A real oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of this vibrant city.

reviews.title: A must visit in NY
reviews.text: This is a must if you visit NY Itâ€™s over 800 acres so you will not see it all. We got a trip on a bike with a cart as we were limited with time. Our guide took us to all the best locations within the park. You will need to be fit if you want to spend some time walking within the park Its open until late at night

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: We walked around the park including the Jackie Onassis reservoir.  Such a quiet place in the middle of a busy city. There was plenty of activity going on, you can hire bikes to ride or go for one of the horse drawn carriages. Be aware of people taking photos of men sunbathing!

reviews.title: Allow plenty of time
reviews.text: If you want to extensively explore Central Park, make sure you allow plenty of time because it is much larger than you expect it to be. We walked from Columbus Circle to Bethesda Terrace before we needed to turn around and head back. We were moving slower than usual as it was around 34 degrees Celsius and very humid that day. I would have liked to see Belvedere Castle and Strawberry Fields, so make sure you look at a map of Central Park and plan your exploration.

reviews.title: NYC oasis!
reviews.text: Spent an entire day walking around Central Park and exploring. This park is amazing! So much beauty and history. Walking up Sixth Ave to get here and it was very loud. Sirens, car horns, and overwhelming city noise. Once you get 100 feet into the park the city goes away. You can actually hear birds chirping, wind through trees, and silence. The city disappears. My favorite by far was Belvedere Castle. Also loved Bethesda Fountain, The Mall, and Turtle Pond. When visiting New York City this park is a must. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: 1st Visit
reviews.text: 1st visit to the Park and we really enjoyed the walk and park.  The Park is a lot bigger than we thought so due to time we didnâ€™t get to see everything we wanted but will visit again.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: I enjoyed the park. I felt very safe. The grounds were well maintained. Everyone was relaxing and having a good time. I enjoyed the zoo. The playground for the kids was very nice. Lots of areas to play. There are also baseball fields and tennis courts

reviews.title: Gear
reviews.text: Huge park, be ready to walk, but also guys in a electric bike with a nice comfy seats will take you around and give you history of the park, like jhon lennon home, J.Lo home , how was made the park and so on

reviews.title: Trip to New York
reviews.text: Visited New York in march for a surprise. Took the afternoon to have a chilled one and walk around the park. The weather was amazing and it was so relaxing and no hustle and bustle. Made you forget that you were in the middle of New York City. Nice little restaurant in the middle that serves delicious iced coffees and amazing cakes.

reviews.title: Stay away from centralpark.com
reviews.text: Do not book anything through centralpark.com. They cancelled our booking when I queried about a refund, I did not ask to cancel. Then after months of emailing them to reinstate I received no response. I emailed the contact email and zero response, no number to call. They do not help, they take your money and do not provide any service.

reviews.title: Fun visit to Central Park at New York City !!
reviews.text: I visited to Central Park with my friends and it was a fantastic visit. The park is really huge and beautiful and it is right in the middle of the city. A perfect place to escape and enjoy nature. You can also plan a picnic with your friends if you are having a visit !!

reviews.title: Beautiful park
reviews.text: Really lovely big park. Walked part Of it . Got a hop on and  hop off  bus which takes you around the road outside . Also got a tuk tuk and they showed us all the parts which were used in films

reviews.title: Urban Oasis
reviews.text: Having explored Central Park firsthand, I can attest to its allure. It's a sprawling oasis, offering respite from the city's hustle. Whether strolling along its winding paths, picnicking on its lush lawns, or simply soaking in its serene ambiance, Central Park is an essential NYC experience.

reviews.title: Lovely place
reviews.text: We loved the park so much we went twice in four days. We ate bagels for breakfast in the park and started our hectic days the right way! Avoid the sellers apart from the fruit thatâ€™s yummy! Plenty of toilets dotted about and live musicians also around the park.

reviews.title: A lovely place to take a break from the city
reviews.text: Central Park is just a lovely place to take a break from the city. We pretty much only walked through it to get to other parts of the city, and we stopped on benches along the way. I was glad there were people selling water and beverages - we needed that in the heat.

reviews.title: A relaxing visit to Central Park
reviews.text: My wife and I visited NYC with our daughter, son-in-law and three grandsons this past summer.  One morning we visited Central Park and took a leisurely stroll around the lake and went to Belvedere Castle.  It was a relaxing day in the midst of the frenzy of New York.

reviews.title: Oasis in the concrete city
reviews.text: Amid the bustle of the city, Central Park offers everyone the opportunity to just slow down and bask in the sun. Lots of lawn to picnic, track for cycling and lots of paths for meandering around and just think. The  imported beer at the Little cafe off of the baseball fields was perfectly chilled too!! I especially enjoyed the tranquility of the Sanctuary and sat on the beautiful benches every few minutes.

reviews.title: A great place to visit.
reviews.text: What a beautiful park, you can have a picnic or a nice stroll around the park and enjoy some food and drinks at one of the nice cafes. Just be careful of the bikes which try to take you around the park Some of them are not licensed and insured and will try and rob you. If you want to be taken around the park on one of the bikes and given a tour, make sure that they have an ID tag and you can always get the price down if you haggle. The Zoo is not the biggest but itâ€™s in a city. Overall itâ€™s a great place to visit.

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: This is a great place to escape the city and crowds. We had visited the Natural History museum and then spent an hour having a picnic and walking to the South East corner to hire a bike to explore the park. Although we covered more ground, I think it's easier to explore the park on foot, as it was so busy. It was a Monday afternoon in May.

reviews.title: Central Park Impresses
reviews.text: My husband, daughter (15) and I wandered around Central Park the first day we got into NYC. It was a Saturday late afternoon. It was fun to see the many people utilizing the park, yet it wasnâ€™t overwhelmingly packed. We checked out a few specific areas made famous by movies. Definitely didnâ€™t explore as much as we wanted. I think it would take days upon days to see all Central Park has to offer.

reviews.title: "Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads."
reviews.text: Few pleasures are more exquisite or simple than walking through Central Park with a cup of coffee and no particular destination at all in mind. If the rest of Manhattan represents all the responsibilities of life, entering Central Park represents setting aside all that dull care for a looping stroll redolent of childhood. It never occurred to me to review a park before, yet here I am. It's a convenient and splendid escape from work and life when you need it. To borrow from Thoreau: "Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads."

reviews.title: Excellent tour of Central Park
reviews.text: We did a pedicab tour through the park today using Central Park Attractions. I highly recommend them. Our guide was amazing. He was fun and informative. We were able to stop and take a ton and f photos and we were able to see so much of the park.

reviews.title: Very relaxing
reviews.text: You canâ€™t visit New York and not visit Central Park. The sprawling green space and intermittent live music makes for a relaxing stroll with family. We had breakfast every morning on the rock next to the playground - very relaxing and fantastic views. Make sure you visit Gaston bridge - one of the locations and backdrops in the film Home Alone 2!

reviews.title: Make a day of it
reviews.text: You canâ€™t visit New York City without stepping foot in Central Park. We made a day of it to make sure we saw as many of the sites and landmarks we could.

reviews.title: Peaceful Park
reviews.text: Visited: 12/07/2023 A huge and beautiful iconic park in the centre of New York City. You cannot truly grasp the size of it until you step inside it. Lots of cycle lanes, runners, people enjoying the sunshine on the grass, plenty of benches, ponds for the ducks to swim, and even a castle inside it. There are lots of trees for shade, and even on busy days you donâ€™t feel overcrowded due to the sheer size of the Park.

reviews.title: The most beautiful park ever
reviews.text: Central Park is an absolute DREAM! By far the most beautiful park Iâ€™ve ever seen in my life. Came from Europe (10.000 miles away) to explore and experience NYC. Iâ€™ve seen so many movies and series that take place in NYC, but I never thought it would be THAT PRETTY! Must be angles and all that, right!? WRONG. This park is spotless. So clean, so beautiful, so peaceful. 10/10. No, 100/10. If you love nature, walks and beautiful sights, come to Central Park. It doesnâ€™t even feel like a park in a city. In certain areas it literally feels like youâ€™re hiking. It is big enough to not feel uncomfortably crowded, there are squirrels and raccoons and other cute animals just hanging around, and even in gloomy weather, itâ€™s still stunning!

reviews.title: Sunrise
reviews.text: If you wake up early and catch the sunrise by the lakes you can get some beautiful pictures. Generally, most parts of Central Park are safe, but as with anywhere you have to be careful.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: Central Park has something for everyone. Running, cycles walking dogs tennis paddle board boating plus restaurants and statutes.

reviews.title: You canâ€™t not visit Central Park!!!
reviews.text: This was my first trip to New York after many years of wanting to visit and I was happy to fully commit to the tourist trail. Central Park was therefore high on my list of must visits. Itâ€™s hard to really understand the scale of the park until youâ€™re there so to make the most of our day we hired bikes which made for a brilliant day out and great way of seeing everything. Itâ€™s a pretty flat park so the cycling was easy and pretty well laid out with specific cycle lanes and really friendly volunteers giving directions and very politely letting you knowing youâ€™re cycling in the wrong areas. So many iconic views and places in the park and really great audio descriptions that you can access on your phone about the history of the park and specific areas. We also visited the Met and The Guggenheim whilst we were there so you could spend a whole day there and still need to return to see more. Of course the classics such as the Zoo, the Boat House, the carousel, the turtles all need to be visited but itâ€™s also a lovely green space with amazing views of Manhattan and a perfect place to chill out and watch the world go by.

reviews.title: A Green Oasis in the Heart of NYC
reviews.text: Central Park is an absolute gem in the middle of New York City. It's the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle, offering lush greenery, serene lakes, and picturesque paths. Whether you're walking, biking, or just relaxing, there's something for everyone. Highlights include the stunning Bethesda Terrace, the peaceful Bow Bridge, and the Central Park Zoo. A must-visit for nature lovers and city dwellers alike!

reviews.title: Lots of fun and the buskers were amazing
reviews.text: Lots of fun and endless exploration. My favorite part was the busking and little shops like Characatures throughout the park.

reviews.title: Central Park from 52 street to about 72 street in 3 hours?
reviews.text: We had a great time at Central Park yesterday. We hot off the subway around 52 Street and wandered into the park. It was great to see native New Yorkers relaxing in their natural environment. My kids liked to climb rocks and pet dogs with owners permission. We could have rented a rowboat for $25 per hour I think . We fed soft pretzel crumbs to the turtles at a lake and walked around the lake. This was not the Onassis reservoir, but a smaller lake. We rode back to port authority from the 72 street station by the Dakota where John Lennon lived.

reviews.title: Magnificent Central Park
reviews.text: The most amazing Park that we have ever visited. What an experience, from the immaculate gardens and landscape to the impressive cleanliness and facilities available to either walk, run or cycle. The most spectacular sites to see in the park with the most amazing views and photo opportunities.

reviews.title: So much to see
reviews.text: We spent time in Central Park every day during our four days and only saw a little bit. There are lots of food trucks lining it to grab food for a picnic. The conservatory gardens are really north but lovely. The reservoir is a great place for a run with locals. We enjoyed breakfast at the Le Pain Quotidien by sheepâ€™s meadow. Every bridge, every small body of water, every tree lined area and every meadow was lovely. We walked across it after dark and stayed to well lit paths and didnâ€™t feel unsafe and got to see fireflies! So many cute dogs going for walks. We also saw several rats.

reviews.title: Absolute must do a cool sanctuary on a hot summer day!!
reviews.text: A cool shady sanctuary in the hot NYC summer! We visited here and hired bikes on a hot humid day and thoroughly enjoyed exploring. Incredible kids playground if you have younger kids!

reviews.title: Lovely day out
reviews.text: Unfortunately we didnâ€™t have that much time to enjoy but as soon as you step into the park you hear sound of birds and leaves from the trees. Beautiful place for everyone to enjoy. Highly recommend

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Fantastic parc, lots of shade on a warm day in New York, and lots of iconic sights such as the statue of the famous Balto, the loyal dog.

reviews.title: Central Park, Does What It Say's on The Tin!
reviews.text: Absolutely love this park especially on a sunny June morning. Our intention was to walk around the park but it was very warm so decided to take a bike carriage. The lovely guide was very knowledgeable and stopped at various points of interest to enable us to take photos and generally suck up the wonderful atmosphere. People cycling, walking, blading,  altogether quite lovely.  Amongst the most famous landmarks were, Strawberry Fields, John Lennon's home, Yoko still lives there and The Alice in Wonderland statue along with the famous fountain featured in Friends. There is loads to see end experience. Would thoroughly recommend if you haven't been there before.

reviews.title: Fun day out
reviews.text: What am amazing park to visit. The wildlife alone enticed me to keep on walking deeper into the park. The locals are all very down to earth people who are happy to help

reviews.title: Central Park is relaxing fun for everyone
reviews.text: I have been to New York many times but never went to Central Park. It was such lovely weather and we decided to have a picnic there. Firstly, it was so well-maintained. We found a spot and were happy to see so many families and couples lying around and having a relaxing time. We did the same. We also tasted the corndogs and some other snacks. Best corndog I have ever had! The experience led us to also try the horse-drawn carriages, which was also enjoyable. We all know horses have a certain scent, so be prepared for that.  All-in-all a relaxing experience and definitely enjoyable for anyone.

reviews.title: Sunday Morning Stroll
reviews.text: Great escape from the busy city.  Amazing how secluded you feel after getting just steps into the park.  Lots of great stops to stop and sit and relax. Another must see checked off the list of things to do in NYC!

reviews.title: Beautiful, but heavy urine smell when we went.
reviews.text: Beautiful, but smelled strongly of human urine. We only walked around 5 min or so, but it was such a turn off. Not the fault of NYC of course. Food trucks inside.

reviews.title: Wonderful Park
reviews.text: Such a beautiful park! Itâ€™s absolutely enormous and so much to see I suspect we only scratched the surface. Wonderful wildlife to spot. My only criticism is that there are very few signs and whilst they recommend downloading the app we actually were looking for an experience away from our phones.

reviews.title: Iconic
reviews.text: Central Park is truly a gem in the heart of New York City, offering a perfect blend of tranquility and urban energy. We explored this iconic park through a guided bike tour and leisurely walks, soaking in its natural beauty and historical landmarks. The guided bike tour was informative and enjoyable, providing insights into the park's rich history and hidden gems. We pedaled through winding paths, past lush greenery, and iconic sights like Bethesda Terrace and Strawberry Fields. Walking through the park allowed us to appreciate its vastness and diverse landscapesâ€”from scenic lakes to charming bridges and vibrant gardens. Central Park is not just a park; it's a sanctuary amidst the bustling city, offering endless opportunities for recreation and relaxation. Whether you're a local or a visitor, exploring Central Park is a must-do experience that captures the essence of New York City's vibrant spirit. We can't wait to return and discover more of its beauty!

reviews.title: Just relax and feel nature escaping city.
reviews.text: Vast lawn, natural animals like sciurus, birds and ducks. Great trees make me calm and tranquil. If I have a enough time, I want to spend here all day.

reviews.title: Lots to see!
reviews.text: We spent a significant amount of time in the park and I would say that we saw 75% of it.  It is a huge area with lots of different things to see.  We had a list of "must sees" and found it helpful to guide us in the direction we wanted to go when we would approach a sign with choices.  Lots of fountains, statues, ponds, flowers and turtles!  An enjoyable, but very hot and humid afternoon.  Crowds were not as bad as I had expected for a Saturday.  We were there from 12:00-3:00.

reviews.title: Most visited urban park in the United States
reviews.text: Did you know that more gunpowder was used to clear the area of soil and rocks for Central Park in New York City than was used at the battle of Gettysburg in the Civil War? Yet Central Park is only the fifth largest park in New York City. But it is the most visited urban park in the United States with an estimated 42 million visitors annually. Located between the Upper West Side and Upper East Side neighborhoods of Manhattan, Central Park is bordered by Central Park North at 110th Street, Central Park South at 59th Street, Central Park West at 8th Avenue and Fifth Avenue on the east, Harlem to the north and Midtown Manhattan to the south. Designed by architects  Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux, the 843-acre property was opened to the public in 1858. The first landscaped park in the United States, it is worth $528 billion by today's value scale. It contains five visitors centers, 21 children's playgrounds, eight lakes and ponds, all created artificially, more than 20,000 trees, is patrolled by its own New York City Police Department precinct, is surrounded b a 29,025-foot-long and three feet, 10 inches high stone wall, 29 sculptures, 26 baseball fields, 12 tennis courts, eight basketball courts, two ice skating rinks, seven soccer fields, four volleyball courts and two indoor restaurants. Wildlife that inhabit the park includes fish, turtles, frogs, bats, squirrels, chipmunks, opossum and birds. No snakes. Open from 6 a.m. to 1 a.m. daily, The park also features four drives, 6.1 miles long, that are used by runners, joggers, pedestrians, bicyclists, inline skaters and scooters. And there are three scenic drives that highlight New York City's skyline. Main attractions are Ramble and Lake, the Central Park zoo, Hallett Nature Sanctuary, Wollman Rink, Central Park Carousel, Sheep Meadow, the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir and Delacoste Theater. It is one of the most filmed locations in the world and has been the site of several major events, including the Simon and Garfunkel concert in 1981 and the Garth Brooks concert in 1997. Two interesting attractions are Cleopatra's Needle, a red granite obelisk and the oldest man-made structure in Central Park that originally was erected in ancient Egypt in 1,450 BC; and Strawberry Fields, a 2.5-acre landscaped section which commemorates the life of John Lennon, who was murdered outside the nearby Dakota apartment building in 1980. Central Park was declared a National Historic Landmark in 1963, added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1966 and designated a New York City scenic landmark in 1974.

reviews.title: Great part of NYC
reviews.text: C'mon, I mean, it's Central Park! This was our second visit and we never tire of seeing new areas and people watching. After visiting the Guggenheim, we walked through the park and enjoyed seeing the trees, carousel, lake and wildlife (turtles, birds, fish). We got coffee by the boathouse and just soaked it all in. We didn't see any buskers/performers this time but we know they're always around. Go and enjoy the park.

reviews.title: A Haven of Calm form the City
reviews.text: I've visited Central Park numerous times during the last 32 years and at different times of the year. It's a tranquil place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. I visited early on a Friday morning so there's only joggers and locals walking their dogs at this time. The park is full of statutes, view points, bridges, tunnels and lakes. There's always something to see, plus the addition of bird and wildlife.

reviews.title: Wow wow wow
reviews.text: What a place. It. Is. Huge!! We didnâ€™t even get half way through it was that big and we were running out of time. There is so much to see and do here.

reviews.title: Nature within the city that never sleeps
reviews.text: This is a beautiful vast park with many facets. I would say that if visiting New York you should make some time to explore at least some of the park. You will likely feel calm and reinvigorated as a result.

reviews.title: Beautiful park but manlets detected
reviews.text: Central Park is a gorgeous and immense public garden, featuring a massive lake and even a zoo, in the heart of New York City. An oasis of peace and recreation - a fun, safe and clean environment to spend a relaxing day away from the hustle and bustle of the big city. As I was leisurely walking through the park I detected a gaggle of manlets dressed up as garden gnomes attempting to steal women's high heels! The stunted manlets were quickly scared off when one of the women's pet chihuahua detected them and confronted the perfidious manlets while barking loudly. Hilarity ensued as the gnomish manlets fled in terror! The approaching chihuahua must have been like a charging grizzly bear to the petite and insignificant manlet boys. Manlets BTFO.

reviews.title: A place I always go to
reviews.text: It is one of the place I always go to whenever I visit NYC. It is beautiful, sakura kind of cherry tree blossom in spring time, fall leaves in fall, vibrant green  and mirror like lake water in summer.  You will never got bore in Central park

reviews.title: Tranquility in the madness!
reviews.text: We cycled around the park for the afternoon. Great experience and perfect for a family or couple. Stop off and take the peace in.

reviews.title: Great, safe area to explore
reviews.text: We enjoyed our time in Central Park. A refreshing break from the hustle of the city. Easy to walk and safe. The sales people trying to get business to peddle people around make it sound like a feat to walk but the entire park can be easily walked with a decent fitness level.

reviews.title: The feeling of the heaven
reviews.text: Every single step of the national park gives  you a feeling of the life . Passing the the gardens , smelling the nature you can spend hours around the park

reviews.title: The beauty
reviews.text: Where do I start? Letâ€™s just say you havenâ€™t visited New York City if youâ€™ve never strolled Central Park. Its easy to navigate landscapes and breathtaking views make for an enjoyable walk. The park is great for dogs too and includes several trash and recycling receptacles along the paths. There are also helpful planning tools on centralpark.com to make your visit worthwhile. Enjoy!

reviews.title: Central Park
reviews.text: A PARK at CENTRAL PARK. for KIDS FEEL the MOMENT at this Time... Central Park in New York City...so beautiful Park..It would be Wonderful.. a nice view at the fountain and lake river..absolutely. good for a walk in the evening. Handle a coffee and sandwuches.. for snack. Looking for a good place where to stay and relaxing while you eat..mostly kids were enjoying riding at horse chartels..they are happy...andctheres also a funny activities to show ....very wide greenery Park. At Central Park NYC..kids enjoyed & happy together and adults...

reviews.title: A Must Walk
reviews.text: Central Park is a peaceful space from the bustling NYC City. Itâ€™s a huge park with landscapes designed by Frederick La Olmsted, many of them famous from the movie Home Alone. Central Park was the first public park. Over 300 movies were filmed here.

reviews.title: Perfect Park Visit
reviews.text: Central Park is so beautiful. Itâ€™s a wonderful place to walk or sit and the grass is so soft and comfortable. There were lots of people doing picnics as well and plenty of places to run. You have to come here if you go to New York.

reviews.title: Only saw a fraction of it!
reviews.text: I didn't see very much of the park - it is massive - but I enjoyed what I did see. There's a lovely nature reserve but where they had turtles. Also statues of historical figures (Robbie Burns etc.). The information plaques were helpful. There's a lot going on in the park and I only saw a fraction of it. There are some lovely views of the city.

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.text: Who couldn't love central Park. Its like walking onto a movie set. So many familiar sites. That aside it is very beautiful place to exercise or just sit relax and enjoy the scenic views.

reviews.title: Beautiful park
reviews.text: Sunday morning & the whole of Manhattan seems to be out enjoying this beautiful park. So quiet and peaceful with the backdrop of the city in the background.

reviews.title: Perfect for both locals and tourists.
reviews.text: Central Park in New York city is an iconic urban place. Spanning 843 acres, it offers serene paths, expansive lawns and attractions like the Central Park Zoo. It's beautifully maintained escape from the city, perfect for both locals and tourists.

reviews.title: It was a great place to run or stroll off all those calories!
reviews.text: The park is huge, so I just visited a tiny portion of it, but I must admit that I forgot I was in the midst of New York City....

reviews.title: We just explored a little part of the park, but what we saw was amazing.
reviews.text: With so many fields and walking/biking pathways, it's clear that the inhabitants make good use of them. Mature woodlands.

reviews.title: Amazing visit
reviews.text: We had an incredible vacation. We visited Central Park and we were really captivated. The kids and we really enjoyed the day, spending it quietly after walking around the city. I think it's a must-see if you go to the city. Everything is clean and in order.

reviews.title: Central Park is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of NYC
reviews.text: Central Park is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of New York City. Whether you're looking to go for a leisurely walk, have a picnic, or simply relax by the water, this park offers something for everyone. I especially loved the tranquil beauty of the Bethesda Terrace and the vibrant atmosphere around the Great Lawn. It's easy to forget you're in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world.

reviews.title: Lovely visit to Central park
reviews.text: The views were beautiful! Grass was blomming green. Very hilly around Central park. Definley take photos! Be papared for change of the weather 10/10

reviews.title: big park with roads???
reviews.text: good park for a big city like New York and this is a nice one. we spent about 3 hours here and had a good time. It is kind of a big park with roads in the middle witch kind of strange for me since a park is for walking and cycling and not driving but I guess USA loves the car so that makes this normal here... I would recommend this to someone that's moving or visiting for a long time in New York since its still just a park.

reviews.title: Safe and In Excellent Condition
reviews.text: Definitely include this park on your visit.  it is very safe and in excellent condition.  So many famous spots here, especially the walk under the shade trees past the statues of famous authors and the glorious Bethesda Fountain.  And then there is the Strowberry Fields area.  Take a ride in a pedicab!

reviews.title: Utterly charming
reviews.text: Weâ€™ve all seen it in the movies, and when a place is so iconic and has been part of the lives of people all over the world through film, it would be easy for it to disappoint. It did not disappoint. A huge, varied and welcoming space, even in August it wasnâ€™t anywhere near as busy as we expected and although it was a hot day, the tree cover and the fact that with the open space you get a breeze, made it a real delight to stroll through.  So many charming moments - the public chess/checkers tables (we were challenged to a game by a local!), the playgrounds that our family is way beyond but would be fantastic for younger children, the public loos (spotless), the street vendors (best pretzels in NYC), the gift shop (excellent gifts at very fair prices). Exceeded our expectations in every way ğŸ¥°

reviews.title: Central Park
reviews.text: We  had a nice time in New York Central Park is really beautiful and very clean . It is one of the most popular places to to if it your first time

reviews.title: A great experience
reviews.text: A great tour with Barrie. Definitely to be recommended. Very knowledgeable and informative. Arrive was a lovely man with an extensive knowledge of the area and its history.

reviews.title: famouslordhillmuseum top rated shropshire purveyors of fine arts on line wanted to visir harris museum pity its closed
reviews.text: englands famouslordhillmuseum in shropshire party arrived to newyork to fine antiques and fine arts to add to out lordhillcollections on line on vinterior store collectors can bid on lots the admire rated as top class sellers by our fans worldwide cenral park is stunning and our curator expert lord leslie had a wonerfull time around new york we sell to fine art collectors across usa dailt shipments overseas done

reviews.title: Blighted by Dope
reviews.text: Iâ€™m afraid this beautiful park, like a lot of New York is blighted by frequent, inescapable pungent smells of marujuana. So disappointing and so unpleasant, especially with family. The same for New York in general. It frequently made my wife and feel nauseous. Absolutely, disgusting

reviews.title: Definitely worth a visit
reviews.text: When in NYC, a visit at Central Park is certainly worth it. The park is major part of the city's identity and history. It nice to wander in the green corners, relaxing and in some occasions, feeling like playing in a movie.

reviews.title: The central park
reviews.text: Strolling through Central Park, we found a peaceful environment perfect for a couple's retreat. The lush meadows offered a refreshing break from city life, while the public art captivated our artistic senses. It's an ideal spot for those seeking tranquility and cultural enrichment.

reviews.title: Central Park in summer this time!
reviews.text: Was there for the last time in Nov 2022 and the park was beautifully autumn colors. Came back to NY and visitid this August with the heat of the summer, and it was still charming. This time we decided to visit the area that is around the 72th to 79th streets as last time we saw the below part. We saw the Alice and Hans C. Andersen monuments, the Bethseda terrace and Cherry Hill, the John Lennon Imagine tribute and many squirrels, birds and ducks all around!! Lovely walk of around an hour to take amazing photos and feed all the cuties we encounter!! Will be back as always!!!!

reviews.title: Lazy day in NY
reviews.text: Itâ€™s always a pleasure to walk in Central Park. It feels like youâ€™re definitely far away from the busy Manhattan. Lying on those vast lawns, watching people spend their time, is a wonderful experience. For anyone visiting New York, itâ€™s a must-see stop.

reviews.title: It's great!
reviews.text: Central Park is an oasis in the midst of bustling New York City. I loved strolling through its pathways, admiring the diverse landscapes, and enjoying the tranquility it offers. The green spaces, lakes, and recreational areas are perfect for relaxation and unwinding. Additionally, the vibrant atmosphere with street performers and cultural events makes it a unique place. Definitely a must-visit for anyone looking for a break in the Big Apple.

reviews.title: Beautiful park with loads of different things
reviews.text: This was so good!! As a family we hired bikes and cycled around the park, stopping at various points for breaks. There were lots of great statues like the Alice in Wonderland, the Obelisk and the Alexander Hamilton statue. There was also a turtle pond with so many cute and lovely turtles which were not shy! They were crawling all over the rocks and ground! They were also building an ice rink which looked really cool! There were LOTS of fruit salad stores and quite a few drinks, food and ice cream stores. It wasnâ€™t very busy as the roads around the park were huge, with traffic lights to help make sure nothing bad happened! There was also a HUGE rock called rat rock which lots of people were climbing and was great fun. I would definitely recommend as there were lots of different things to do!

reviews.title: First time in Central Park
reviews.text: Fun! Great spaces!  New Yorkers certainly need and use this great space. After riding a pedicab through half if it during the day, my impression of it is that itâ€™s a safe place to be during the day. But itâ€™s always safer to be with someone in a large city.

reviews.title: Central Park
reviews.text: Of course we had heard of Central Park before but we had no idea that it was so big! Really nice atmosphere on a sunny day, families and friends picnicing and relaxing on the grass. Lots of winding paths and even a lake. We'd heard of a zoo in Brooklyn, but didn't know Central Park had it's own zoo too! Well maintained.

reviews.title: Best. City. Ever
reviews.text: From squirrels, to dinosaurs what more Is there to see? Take a bike ride on a cold winters morning through the lovely, idyllic, central park

reviews.title: Occasionally, heavenly
reviews.text: The Pool and North Woods, at the northwest part of the park, are my favorite.  Less crowded than the Reservoir and Sheep Meadow, these are quieter spots, perfect for picnic and contemplation.  Recommend daylight visits.  Nice refuge from the bustle of the city, but still open to Tour de France cyclist wannabees' hysteria.  Always look out for the rushed bike riders.  Without human rooted hysteria, this could be heavenly.

reviews.title: Even worth it on a rainy day!
reviews.text: Always worth a visit whenever I come to NYC. Sadly the weather wasnâ€™t so great the morning we were here and it poured in the afternoon, making our visit shorter than we wanted, but we still got to explore the North End throughly, just had to catch a subway home after Belvedere Castle. One of my favorite ways to see the park is to take the subway to 110th, and then walk ALL the way to the south end, just meandering through the park. You stumble upon a lot this way. Itâ€™s a lot of walking but worth it if you have the time to wander!

reviews.title: Simply beautiful
reviews.text: Central Park in New York City is a breathtaking oasis in the heart of one of the busiest cities in the world. The only regret I have is not having more time to explore. There is so much to see and experience, and I could have easily spent a full day wandering through the parkâ€™s many nooks and crannies. If you're in New York City, Central Park is a must-visit.

reviews.title: A fun day of outdoor adventures in Central Park
reviews.text: Our day in Central Park was a breath of fresh air! We enjoyed a variety of outdoor activities, from biking along the scenic paths to picnicking on the grass. The vibrant atmosphere and beautiful landscapes made for the perfect backdrop. We loved every moment spent exploring this iconic urban oasis!

reviews.title: Bathroom tip
reviews.text: So I canâ€™t tell you much that others have said before. Itâ€™s a wonderful urban oasis. Thatâ€™s somewhat lacking in bathrooms. I found one by asking a person by the north entrance to the zoo. Thereâ€™s a white building across the path with double doors a couple steps below the path. The door is locked but at least on Sundays has a security guard behind the door. He will open the door for you and allow you to use the bathroom there.  Thatâ€™s my contribution.

reviews.title: A place of calm in the city
reviews.text: A great place to take a break in. We spent a day walking around Central Park. If you go to one of the info centres you can get a paper map and then go explore. Some wonderful relaxing places as well as busier areas such as the fountain and boating lake. Range of food options and it was great to watch some baseball being played while at one cafe. Nice and cool on an August sunny day under the trees. Simple to get to on the metro. We went and watch a quartet play at sunset which was wonderful.

reviews.title: Green
reviews.text: It was an incredibly hot and humid day in New York and weâ€™d walked everywhere we had planned to and finally ended up in Central Park near Trump tower. The bench we found ourselves sat on and the greenery was such a beautiful contrast to the high rise buildings, traffic and people. We walked 7.2 miles that day.

reviews.title: An Urban Oasis in the Heart of NYC
reviews.text: Central park is a must visit in Newyork City!!!!! Itâ€™s an oasis of calm amidst the hustle and bustle of the city. Highly recommend for anyone looking to experience a bit of nature in the city!!!
